intro: Blepharis fleckii, commonly known as the Fleck's beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun, often found in desert or semi-arid environments. Its blooming period occurs during the spring and early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
